practice.explanatin: It is not prescribed in Islam to burn or cremate the dead, rather this is an act of disrespect and dishonour.
practice.explanation: One type is bid\'ah (innovation) is visiting graves for the purpose of calling upon their occupants, seeking their help, offering sacrifices to them and making vows to them. This is forbidden and is a major form of Shirk (shirk akbar).
What is required for the deceased in all cases, whether young or old, male or female, is a single sheet that will cover the entire body of the deceased.

names.name: shrouding the deceased in a piece of cloth

practice.explanation: One type is bid\'ah (innovation) is visiting graves for the purpose of calling upon their occupants, seeking their help, offering sacrifices to them and making vows to them. This is forbidden and is a major form of Shirk (shirk akbar).

names.name: shrouding male deceased in three pieces of cloth

practice.explanation: In Islam, it is best to shroud men in three pieces of cloth and women in five pieces of cloth. The minimum in which the deceased may be shrouded, which fulfills the obligatory duty, is a single piece of cloth that covers the entire body.

names.name: shrouding female deceased in five pieces of cloth

practice.explanation: Turning the deceased to face the Qiblah is good, but if this is not done it does not matter. There is no text (nass) which indicates that the deceased should be turned to face the Qiblah. The deceased should be placed in his grave on his right side, with his face towards the Qiblah and his head and legs to the right and left. This is the practice of the Muslims from the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) until the present day, and this is how all the graveyards of the Muslims are throughout the world. (al-Mahallaa, 5/173).

practice.explanatin: It is not prescribed in Islam to burn or cremate the dead, rather this is an act of disrespect and dishonour.
practice.explanation: One type is bid\'ah (innovation) is visiting graves for the purpose of calling upon their occupants, seeking their help, offering sacrifices to them and making vows to them. This is forbidden and is a major form of Shirk (shirk akbar).
What is required for the deceased in all cases, whether young or old, male or female, is a single sheet that will cover the entire body of the deceased.

names.name: shrouding female deceased in five pieces of cloth

practice.explanation: Turning the deceased to face the Qiblah is good, but if this is not done it does not matter. practice.explanatin: It is not prescribed in Islam to burn or cremate the dead, rather this is an act of disrespect and dishonour.
practice.explanation: One type is bid\'ah (innovation) is visiting graves for the purpose of calling upon their occupants, seeking their help, offering sacrifices to them and making vows to them. This is forbidden and is a major form of Shirk (shirk akbar).
What is required for the deceased in all cases, whether young or old, male or female, is a single sheet that will cover the entire body of the deceased.
